titlestmt.titleproper: W. A. Leonard receipt from purchase of a print

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:12:13 -0400.

did.unittitle: W. A. Leonard receipt from purchase of a print

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A receipt from the firm of Frederick Keppel for a woodcut by Albrecht Durer, sold for 5 dollars to the Rev. W. A. Leonard on March 15, 1875. The receipt is signed by Keppel's assistant, W[illiam] Macbeth.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 3091 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frederick Keppel was the founder of Frederick Keppel and Co. and William Macbeth was his assistant who later founded the well-known Macbeth Gallery in New York City.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The document was presented to Sherman Lee who in turn gave it to the Archives of American Art.
